answers.answer: Hi,I don’t think it’s due to a pinching of the nerve. Usually, when a nerve is pinched, it involves only one of the legs and not both of them simultaneously. Firstly, a blood sugar must be done to rule out diabetes mellitus as it can present with similar symptoms. An EMG (electromyogram) should also be done to rule out a muscle disease although a burning and tingling sensation as described by you increases the possibility of a neurological disease.I sincerely feel that you should get yourself examined by a neurologist as a good neurological examination is a must before you proceed further.I hope that helps. Please do keep me posted.Kind Regards.
